summary:
I read Yordi's thoughtful post, Embracing the Pain, and got the urge for a new July Reply.  Running has never been my thing, but that was not the essence of his post anyway.  What caught my eye were these last lines:

Life seems designed to throw challenges at you, again and again...
title: Re: Embracing the Pain

summary:
Yesterday I was watching a Swedish music documentary.  In one of the scenes, the artist Errol (aka Eddie Meduza) says:

If you think too much, you go crazy.  Take life as it comes...
title: Don't think too much

summary:
I didn’t know:
In 1994, Hewlett-Packard released a miracle machine: the HP 200LX pocket-size PC.  In the depths of the device, among the MS-DOS productivity apps built into its fixed memory, there lurked a first-person maze game called Lair of Squid. 
[…]
In Lair of Squid, you’re trapped in an underwater labyrinth, seeking a way out while avoiding squid roaming the corridors...
title: Friday Squid Blogging: 1994 Lair of Squid Game
